required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PD-L1 Targeting Molecular Imaging of Gastrointestinal Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: PD-L1 Targeting Molecular Imaging of Gastrointestinal Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to constrcut a noninvasive approach 68Ga-WL12 PET/CT to detect the PD-L1 expression of tumor lesions in patients with gastrointestinal tumors and to identify patients benefiting from anti-PD-1/L1 treatment.

primary_outcome.description: The uptake of the tracer in the primary and metastatic tumor lesions by measuring standardized uptake value（SUV）on PET/CT

arm_group.description: All study participants will be allocated to this arm (single-arm study).Study participants will undergo 68Ga-WL12 PET/CT scans

intervention.description: WL12, labeled with PET radio-nuclide ( Ga-68 )will be used as a molecular imaging tracer for PET/CT scanning
